snippet: In 1989, a Chinese general refused to take part in violence against protesters, sending tremors through the Communist Party establishment, documents and interviews show.
abstract: Documents and interviews show that in 1989, Chinese Maj Gen Xu Qinxian refused to take part in violence against student protesters in Tiananmen Square, sending shudders through the Communist Party establishment; new details of general's defiance and tremors it set off are among series of disclosures about intrigue inside Chinese military preceding bloody crackdown, modifying accepted understanding of divisive event.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing and Hebei Province.

lead_paragraph: In 1989, a Chinese general refused to take part in violence against protesters, sending tremors through the Communist Party establishment, documents and interviews show.

headline.main: Tales of Army Discord Show Tiananmen Square in a New Light
headline.print_headline: Tales of Army Discord Show Tiananmen Square in a New Light
